intro: Hieracium homostegium, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are deeply lobed and hairy. Its flowers are bright yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium homostegium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
